sentences.english: The cicada is stilled. The chorus of the cricket and katydid diminishes.
sentences.chinese: 秋蝉安静下来，蟋蟀和蚱蜢的合唱声减弱。

sentences.english: Even if you can get past the dirtiness, the guy apparently only eats crickets.
sentences.chinese: 即使你能接受他的肮脏，还有一点，他只吃蟋蟀。

sentences.english: Cricket fighting is banned in Hong Kong.
sentences.chinese: 在香港是禁止斗蟋蟀的。

sentences.english: A cave cricket is caught in the sticky clutches of a king sundew .
sentences.chinese: 一只洞穴蟋蟀被帝王毛毡苔粘稠的触须抓住了。

sentences.english: They were probably no wiser than a cricket's chirrup.
sentences.chinese: 它们并不比一只蟋蟀唧唧的叫声更加高明。

sentences.english: Cricket is built by blisters, crops.
sentences.chinese: 蟋蟀上房叫，庄稼挨水泡。

sentences.english: Professor Crawley: Of course I can.
sentences.chinese: 教授，您能辨别蟋蟀品种吧？

sentences.english: The only thing I could listen to falling asleep was the crickets' chirping.
sentences.chinese: 我困觉前独一能听见的就是蟋蟀的啼声。

sentences.english: Dropping from the veils of the mourning to where the cricket sings;
sentences.chinese: 降低从早晨的幕幛，到蟋蟀吟唱的地点。

sentences.english: Pinocchio laughed. He didn't believe the cricket.
sentences.chinese: 皮诺奇笑了笑，并不相信这只蟋蟀。

sentences.english: He angrily stomped his cricket after failing the fight.
sentences.chinese: 比赛失败后，他生气地踏死了他的蟋蟀。

sentences.english: A collection of crickets for sale.
sentences.chinese: 一些收藏级的蟋蟀正在出售。

sentences.english: Bateman say he was surprised by how sophisticated the crickets' defence responses are.
sentences.chinese: 贝特曼说他惊讶于这蟋蟀的防御反应会如此的精细。

sentences.english: Pacman Horned Frog eats cricket but not success.
sentences.chinese: 白化角蛙食蟋蟀，但不成功。

sentences.english: Above, ornamental singing crickets sit in small cages.
sentences.chinese: 装饰用的“歌唱蟋蟀”正卧在小小的笼子中。

sentences.english: Cricket fighting has long followed the rhythms of nature.
sentences.chinese: 长久以来，斗蟋蟀都是遵循自然规律进行的。

definition: erhua variant of 蟈蟈|蝈蝈[guo1 guo5]
mole cricket/Gryllolaptaptidae, family of burrowing insects of order Orthoptera (a serious agricultural pest)
